articles.title: Europe and Asia, alarmed by COVID variant, tighten borders - Reuters
articles.description: Global authorities reacted with alarm on Friday to a new coronavirus variant detected in South Africa, with the EU, Britain and India among those announcing stricter border controls as scientists sought to determine if the mutation was vaccine-resistant.
articles.content: LONDON/GENEVA, Nov 26 (Reuters) - Global authorities reacted with alarm on Friday to a new coronavirus variant detected in South Africa, with the EU, Britain and India among those announcing stricter… [+4441 chars]

articles.author: Associated Press
articles.title: Asian markets sink as investors weigh latest global virus concerns - MarketWatch
articles.description: Asian stock markets sank Friday as traders watched a surge in coronavirus cases in Europe and anti-disease controls that threaten to disrupt trade and travel.
articles.content: BEIJING (AP) Asian stock markets sank Friday after some European countries tightened curbs on travel and business following a surge in coronavirus infections and South Africa reported a new variant.S… [+2438 chars]

articles.author: Jade Boyd
articles.title: Orbital harmony limits late arrival of water on TRAPPIST-1 planets - Phys.Org
articles.description: Seven Earth-sized planets orbit the star TRAPPIST-1 in near-perfect harmony, and U.S. and European researchers have used that harmony to determine how much physical abuse the planets could have withstood in their infancy.

articles.title: Germany giving nearly 2 million workers a raise - CTV News
articles.description: Almost 2 million workers in Europe's biggest economy are set for a big pay rise. As part of the coalition agreement, Germany plans to raise its minimum wage to €12 an hour.
articles.content:
Almost 2 million workers in Europe's biggest economy are set for a big pay rise.

articles.title: Dublin shares second spot among most innovative cities in Europe - The Irish Times
articles.description: Dortmund comes top with Dublin sharing second place with Malaga in Spain
articles.content:
Dublin has been awarded joint second place in an EU awards ceremony marking the most innovative cities in Europe.
